title: UMKC Coach Resigns Amid Louisville Escort Scandal
text:
Share Article 
Maddie Meyer/Getty Images (KANSAS CITY, Mo.) -- A coach has resigned as the Louisville recruting scandal continues to unfold. 
University of Missouri-Kansas City Assistant Basketball Coach Andre McGee has resigned after allegations surfaced that he hired escorts for recruits and players while he was the Lousiville director of basketball operations. 
According to McGee in a letter to UMKC Director of Athletics Carla Wilson, “The university deserves a full time assistant coach and I am not able to provide that to the basketball team while the false allegations against me are being investigated.” 
The scandal initially unraveled when an escort named Katina Powell alleged in a new book, "Breaking Cardinal Rules," that McGee had paid her $10,000 to perform 22 shows from 2010 to 2014, some of which were at Louisville dormitory, Billy Minardi Hall. 
The NCAA and the University of Louisville are still investigating the allegations.
